If the callback wishes to treat certain portions + * case-insensitively (such as selectors), it should use {@code toLowerCase}, or @@ -121,1 +122,1 @@ - /** Called when an @import is encountered. */ + /** Called when an {@code @import} is encountered. */ @@ -363,3 +364,3 @@ - * Parses identifiers until extraChar is encountered, - * returning the ending token, which will be IDENTIFIER if extraChar - * is found. + * Parses identifiers until {@code extraChar} is encountered, + * returning the ending token, which will be {@code IDENTIFIER} if + * {@code extraChar} is found. @@ -511,3 +512,3 @@ - * Gets an identifier, returning true if the length of the string is greater than 0, - * stopping when stopChar, whitespace, or one of {}()[] is - * hit. + * Gets an identifier, returning {@code true} if the length of the string is + * greater than 0, stopping when {@code stopChar}, whitespace, or one of + * {}()[] is hit. @@ -634,1 +635,1 @@ - * Reads till a stopChar is encountered, escaping characters + * Reads till a {@code stopChar} is encountered, escaping characters
